channel.title: How can I make it so 2 owner can use a certain command?
channel.description: Say you have a command like this [code]if(command.startsWith("setlevel") && playerName.equalsIgnoreCase("Owner")) {[/code] How do I make it so 1 more person would be able to use this command?

item.title: How can I make it so 2 owner can use a certain command?
item.dc:creator: @xxlukexx xxlukexx
item.description:
@xxlukexx wrote:

[quote=“Your Master, post:9, topic:318025”][quote author=xxlukexx link=topic=414534.msg3051571#msg3051571 date=1260123207]

This is lil tricky with that. You must make a new right, make the right 4 and then: if(command.startsWith("setlevel") && playerRights >= 4)
[/quote] The right ‘4’ isn’t in all servers. For the most, Hidden-Admin is right 10 or 11. Some ppl make it right 4, not all.

lol, wtf is that. 4 is hidden admin, which isnt a new right.

anyway, it was wrong.

Did you try? No, so shut it.[/quote]

i garentee that 4 is hidden on MOST servers.

i already told him the code, and he said it was correct and worked.

Read full topic
item.source: How can I make it so 2 owner can use a certain command?

item.title: How can I make it so 2 owner can use a certain command?
item.dc:creator: @The_Chubby_Bunny The Chubby Bunny
item.description:
@The_Chubby_Bunny wrote:

[quote=“xxlukexx, post:3, topic:318025”][quote author=The Chubby Bunny link=topic=414534.msg3051503#msg3051503 date=1260121259]

if(command.startsWith("setlevel") && playerRights >= 2)[br][br][size=1]Posted on: December 06, 2009, 11:42:44 am[/size][hr]it’s actually allowing anyone with player rights of 2 or higher to use the command, if you only want someone with 2 player rights to be able to use it, change the greater-than operator (">=") to an equal to operator (" ==").
[/quote]
no. thats not what hes asking.

if(command.startsWith("setlevel") && playerName.equalsIgnoreCase("Owner") || playerName.equalsIgnoreCase("Owner")) [/quote]

My apologies, sir. Carry on!

Read full topic
